import org.apache.spark._

import org.apache.spark.ml.classification._

import org.apache.spark._

import org.apache.spark.ml._

import org.apache.spark.ml.feature._

import org.apache.spark.ml.classification._

import org.apache.spark.ml.evaluation._

import org.apache.spark.sql.functions._

import org.apache.spark.sql.types._

paragraphs.text:
%md 
For this tutorial, we'll be using data from http://www.transtats.bts.gov/DL_SelectFields.asp?Table_ID=236&DB_Short_Name=On-Time.
The CSV data has been cleaned and tranformed into 2 JSON files with the following format: 
{"dofM":1,"dofW":7,"carrier":"AA","fldate":"2017-01-01","flnum":"1678","origin":"ATL","dest":"LGA","crsdephour":17,"crsdeptime":1700,"depdelay":0.0,"crsarrtime":1912,"arrdelay":0.0,"crselapsedtime":132.0,"dist":762.0}

We use a Scala case class and Structype to define the schema, corresponding to a line in the JSON data file.

msg.data:
For this tutorial, we’ll be using data from http://www.transtats.bts.gov/DL_SelectFields.asp?Table_ID=236&DB_Short_Name=On-Time.
The CSV data has been cleaned and tranformed into 2 JSON files with the following format:
{“dofM”:1,“dofW”:7,“carrier”:“AA”,“fldate”:“2017-01-01”,“flnum”:“1678”,“origin”:“ATL”,“dest”:“LGA”,“crsdephour”:17,“crsdeptime”:1700,“depdelay”:0.0,“crsarrtime”:1912,“arrdelay”:0.0,“crselapsedtime”:132.0,“dist”:762.0}

We use a Scala case class and Structype to define the schema, corresponding to a line in the JSON data file.

paragraphs.title: Define Schema for JSON file data
paragraphs.text:
/*
  {"_id":"AA_2017-01-01_ORD_DEN_2300","dofW":7,"carrier":"AA","origin":"ORD",
  "dest":"DEN","crsdephour":10, "crsdeptime":1005,"depdelay":5.0,"crsarrtime":1145,
  "arrdelay":3.0,"crselapsedtime":160.0,"dist":888.0}
*/  

case class Flight(_id: String, dofW: Integer, carrier: String, origin: String, 
   dest: String,crsdephour:Integer,crsdeptime:Integer,depdelay:Double, crsarrtime:Integer, 
   arrdelay: Double, crselapsedtime: Double, dist: Double) extends Serializable

  val schema = StructType(Array(
    StructField("_id", StringType, true),
    StructField("dofW", IntegerType, true),
    StructField("carrier", StringType, true),
    StructField("origin", StringType, true),
    StructField("dest", StringType, true),
    StructField("crsdephour", IntegerType, true),
    StructField("crsdeptime", IntegerType, true),
    StructField("depdelay", DoubleType, true),
    StructField("crsarrtime", IntegerType, true),
    StructField("arrdelay", DoubleType, true),
    StructField("crselapsedtime", DoubleType, true),
    StructField("dist", DoubleType, true)
  ))

msg.data:
defined class Flight

schema: org.apache.spark.sql.types.StructType = StructType(StructField(_id,StringType,true), StructField(dofW,IntegerType,true), StructField(carrier,StringType,true), StructField(origin,StringType,true), StructField(dest,StringType,true), StructField(crsdephour,IntegerType,true), StructField(crsdeptime,IntegerType,true), StructField(depdelay,DoubleType,true), StructField(crsarrtime,IntegerType,true), StructField(arrdelay,DoubleType,true), StructField(crselapsedtime,DoubleType,true), StructField(dist,DoubleType,true))

paragraphs.title: Read the data from JSON file into a Dataset of type Flight
paragraphs.text:
val df = spark.read.option("inferSchema", "false").schema(schema)
  .json("/user/user01/data/flights20170102.json").as[Flight]
df.count()

paragraphs.title: Register Dataset as a Temporary View in order to explore with SQL
paragraphs.text:
df.createOrReplaceTempView("flights")
spark.catalog.cacheTable("flights")

%md
The describe() function performs summary statistics calculations on  numeric columns

paragraphs.title: Perform summary statistics  on selected columns
paragraphs.text: df.describe("dist", "crselapsedtime","depdelay", "arrdelay").show

paragraphs.title: Calculate the correlation between Departure Delay and Arrival Delay
paragraphs.text:
import org.apache.spark.mllib.stat.Statistics
val depdelay = df.select("depdelay").map{row:Row => row.getAs[Double]("depdelay")}.rdd
val arrdelay = df.select( "arrdelay").map{row:Row => row.getAs[Double]("arrdelay")}.rdd
val correlation = Statistics.corr(depdelay,arrdelay, "pearson")

msg.data:

depdelay: org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD[Double] = MapPartitionsRDD[88] at rdd at <console>:80

arrdelay: org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD[Double] = MapPartitionsRDD[91] at rdd at <console>:80

correlation: Double = 0.9651683038612937

paragraphs.title: Top 5 Longest departure delays

from flights 
order by depdelay desc limit 5

paragraphs.title: Average Departure Delay by Origin
paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT origin, avg(depdelay) as avgdelay
FROM flights 
GROUP BY origin
ORDER BY avgdelay desc

%sql
SELECT dest, avg(depdelay) as avgdelay
FROM flights 
GROUP BY dest
ORDER BY avgdelay desc

%sql
SELECT dofW, avg(depdelay) as avgdelay
FROM flights 
GROUP BY dofW
ORDER BY avgdelay desc

paragraphs.title: Add Labels for Delayed Flights and count
paragraphs.text:
val delaybucketizer = new Bucketizer().setInputCol("depdelay")
  .setOutputCol("delayed").setSplits(Array(0.0,40.0,Double.PositiveInfinity))
val df4= delaybucketizer.transform(df)
df4.groupBy("delayed").count.show

paragraphs.title: Stratify the sampling to fewer Not Delayed

strain.groupBy("delayed").count.show

paragraphs.text:
%md
In order for the features to be used by a machine learning algorithm, they are transformed into numbers representing the value for each feature. Use a combination of StringIndexer and OneHotEncoder to convert the categorical variables in the dataset into numeric variables

msg.data: In order for the features to be used by a machine learning algorithm, they are transformed into numbers representing the value for each feature. Use a combination of StringIndexer and OneHotEncoder to convert the categorical variables in the dataset into numeric variables

paragraphs.title: Use a combination of StringIndexer and OneHotEncoder to encode categorical columns

msg.data:
categoricalColumns: Array[String] = Array(carrier, origin, dest, dofW)

stringIndexers: Array[org.apache.spark.ml.feature.StringIndexerModel] = Array(strIdx_22a8aa414a06, strIdx_89947cf5e7ac, strIdx_5649c89ca6b0, strIdx_73aa1c6066f0)

encoders: Array[org.apache.spark.ml.feature.OneHotEncoder] = Array(oneHot_05be21fa4cd8, oneHot_1d732d6848b3, oneHot_ffffb4d7c95f, oneHot_b09904624872)

paragraphs.title: Use VectorAssembler, a transformer,  to put features into a feature vector column
paragraphs.text:
//bucket the dataset into delayed and not delayed flights with a label 0/1 column 
val labeler = new Bucketizer().setInputCol("depdelay")
   .setOutputCol("label")
   .setSplits(Array( 0.0, 40.0, Double.PositiveInfinity))
val featureCols = Array( "carrierEnc", "destEnc", "originEnc", 
   "dofWEnc","crsdephour","crselapsedtime","crsarrtime","crsdeptime","dist")
//put features into a feature vector column   
val assembler = new VectorAssembler()
   .setInputCols(featureCols)
   .setOutputCol("features")

msg.data:
labeler: org.apache.spark.ml.feature.Bucketizer = bucketizer_987b931ff411

featureCols: Array[String] = Array(carrierEnc, destEnc, originEnc, dofWEnc, crsdephour, crselapsedtime, crsarrtime, crsdeptime, dist)

assembler: org.apache.spark.ml.feature.VectorAssembler = vecAssembler_d004c9b31052

paragraphs.title: Create Decision Tree Estimator , set Label and Feature Columns
paragraphs.text:
val dTree = new DecisionTreeClassifier().setLabelCol("label")
   .setFeaturesCol("features")
   .setMaxBins(7000)

msg.data: dTree: org.apache.spark.ml.classification.DecisionTreeClassifier = dtc_217a2105b168

paragraphs.text:
%md
Set up a pipeline to pass the data through transformers to extract the features and label and pass this to a decision tree estimator to fit the model

msg.data: Set up a pipeline to pass the data through transformers to extract the features and label and pass this to a decision tree estimator to fit the model

paragraphs.title: Set up pipeline with  feature transformers and model estimator
paragraphs.text:
val steps = stringIndexers ++ encoders  ++  Array(labeler, assembler,  dTree)
val pipeline = new Pipeline().setStages(steps)

msg.data:
steps: Array[org.apache.spark.ml.PipelineStage with org.apache.spark.ml.util.MLWritable{def copy(extra: org.apache.spark.ml.param.ParamMap): org.apache.spark.ml.PipelineStage with org.apache.spark.ml.util.MLWritable{def copy(extra: org.apache.spark.ml.param.ParamMap): org.apache.spark.ml.PipelineStage with org.apache.spark.ml.util.MLWritable}}] = Array(strIdx_22a8aa414a06, strIdx_89947cf5e7ac, strIdx_5649c89ca6b0, strIdx_73aa1c6066f0, oneHot_05be21fa4cd8, oneHot_1d732d6848b3, oneHot_ffffb4d7c95f, oneHot_b09904624872, bucketizer_987b931ff411, vecAssembler_d004c9b31052, dtc_217a2105b168)

pipeline: org.apache.spark.ml.Pipeline = pipeline_34fec4a46674

paragraphs.text:
%md
Spark ML supports k-fold cross validation with a transformation/estimation pipeline to try out different combinations of parameters, using a process called grid search. You set up a CrossValidator with the parameters to test, an estimator and evaluator for a model selection workflow.

msg.data: Spark ML supports k-fold cross validation with a transformation/estimation pipeline to try out different combinations of parameters, using a process called grid search. You set up a CrossValidator with the parameters to test, an estimator and evaluator for a model selection workflow.

paragraphs.title: Set up a CrossValidator with the parameters, a tree estimator and evaluator
Fit the model to the input data using K-fold cross validation
paragraphs.text:
val ntrain = strain.drop("delayed").drop("arrdelay")
println(ntrain.count)
ntrain.show

paragraphs.text:
%md
The actual performance of the model can be determined using the test data set which has not been used for any training or cross-validation activities. We'll transform the test set with the model pipeline, which will map the features according to the same recipe.

paragraphs.title: Get Predictions from Test dataset

msg.data: predictions: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [_id: string, dofW: int ... 23 more fields]

paragraphs.text:
%md
Accuracy is measured by the area under the ROC curve. The area measures the ability of the test to correctly classify true positives from false positives. A random predictor would have .5 accuracy. The closer the value is to 1 the better its predictions are. 

In this case, the evaluation returns 82% precision.

msg.data:
Accuracy is measured by the area under the ROC curve. The area measures the ability of the test to correctly classify true positives from false positives. A random predictor would have .5 accuracy. The closer the value is to 1 the better its predictions are.

In this case, the evaluation returns 82% precision.

paragraphs.title: Evaluate the predictions accuracy
paragraphs.text: val accuracy = evaluator.evaluate(predictions)

msg.data: accuracy: Double = 0.8110147861292026

paragraphs.title: Calculate some more metrics
paragraphs.text:
val lp = predictions.select("label", "prediction")
val counttotal = predictions.count()
val label0count  = lp.filter($"label" === 0.0).count()
val pred0count = lp.filter($"prediction" === 0.0).count()
val label1count = lp.filter($"label" === 1.0).count()
val pred1count = lp.filter($"prediction" === 1.0).count()

val correct = lp.filter($"label" === $"prediction").count()
val wrong = lp.filter(not($"label" === $"prediction")).count()
val ratioWrong = wrong.toDouble / counttotal.toDouble
val ratioCorrect = correct.toDouble / counttotal.toDouble
val truep = lp.filter($"prediction" === 0.0)
    .filter($"label" === $"prediction").count() / counttotal.toDouble
val truen = lp.filter($"prediction" === 1.0)
    .filter($"label" === $"prediction").count() / counttotal.toDouble
val falsep = lp.filter($"prediction" === 0.0)
    .filter(not($"label" === $"prediction")).count() / counttotal.toDouble
val falsen = lp.filter($"prediction" === 1.0)
    .filter(not($"label" === $"prediction")).count() / counttotal.toDouble
